background: A railway company is planning transportation infrastructure in the city, focusing on trains and trams with different capacities and building times.
constraints: Number of trams must be at least TramTrainRatio times the number of trains
Total capacity should be at least MinPeople people per hour
objective: Minimize the total number of trains and trams required for transportation
description: A railway company is planning the infrastructure for the city and is considering two types of transportation, trains and trams. Each train can transport \param{TrainCapacity} people per hour comfortably and each tram can transport \param{TramCapacity} people per hour comfortably. Since trains take longer to build, the number of trams must be at least \param{TramTrainRatio} times the number of trains. If the railway company wants to transport at least \param{MinPeople} people per hour, minimize the total number of transportation units required.

parameters.definition: Number of people per hour a train can transport comfortably
Number of people per hour a tram can transport comfortably
Minimum ratio of the number of trams to the number of trains
Minimum number of people per hour to be transported
